Class RendererRegistry

java.lang.Object
com.arbergashi.charts.platform.render.RendererRegistry
public final class RendererRegistry extends Object
Public facade for the renderer registry.

Framework policy: There is exactly one registry of renderer factories. The single source of truth is RendererRegistry. This class exists as the stable public entry point for framework consumers.

Since:
2025-06-17 Part of the Zero-Allocation Render Path. High-frequency execution safe.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Arber Gashi

  • Method Details

    • register

      public static void register(String id, RendererDescriptor descriptor, Supplier<? extends ChartRenderer> factory)
      Registers a renderer factory.

    • getRenderer

      public static ChartRenderer getRenderer(String id)
      Returns a renderer instance by id. May return null if the renderer id is not registered.

    • getOptionalRenderer

      public static Optional<ChartRenderer> getOptionalRenderer(String id)
      Preferred lookup method.

    • getRequiredRenderer

      public static ChartRenderer getRequiredRenderer(String id)
      Strict lookup method.

    • descriptors

      public static Map<String, ? extends RendererDescriptor> descriptors()
      Returns immutable renderer descriptors.

    • metadata

      public static Map<String, RendererMetadata> metadata()
      Returns renderer metadata as stable public API objects.

      This avoids leaking com.arbergashi.charts.internal.* types into consuming applications while keeping the internal registry as the single source of truth.

    • getRendererAffinity

      public static RendererAffinity getRendererAffinity(String id)
      Returns affinity information for a renderer id.

    • getRendererCapabilities

      public static EnumSet<RendererCapability> getRendererCapabilities(String id)
      Returns capability flags for a renderer id.

    • setRendererAffinity

      public static void setRendererAffinity(String id, RendererAffinity affinity)
      Sets affinity information for a renderer id.
